newsitem.title: UK: UK's Labour says to leave top, basic tax unchanged.
newsitem.headline: UK's Labour says to leave top, basic tax unchanged.

text.p: British opposition Labour party finance spokesman Gordon Brown said on Monday he would leave the top and basic income tax rates unchanged if his party were to win the election.
"What I want is for the tax rates to be fair and I will leave the tax rates in the basic and top rate unchanged," Brown told BBC's radio four.
Under the ruling Conservative party. the current top rate of income tax is 40 percent, and the basic rate is 23 percent.
Brown is due to deliver a keynote address on his party's economic plans later on Monday.

In his speech, Brown is expected to set out a tough policy on public sector pay as part of an effort to persuade voters it can be trusted to run the economy responsibly if it wins the election, which must be held by May.
Labour enjoys a lead of almost 20 percentage points over Prime Minister John Major's Conservatives in recent polls.
